delegate(address).details: Delegates votes from the sender to `delegatee`.

delegates(address).details: Returns the delegate that `account` has chosen.

getHookFlags().details: The Vault will only call hooks the pool says it supports, and of course only if a hooks contract is defined (i.e., the `poolHooksContract` in `PoolRegistrationParams` is non-zero). `onRegister` is the only "mandatory" hook.

returns.hookFlags: Flags indicating which hooks the contract supports

getPastTotalSupply(uint256).details: Returns the total supply of votes available at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block. NOTE: This value is the sum of all available votes, which is not necessarily the sum of all delegated votes. Votes that have not been delegated are still part of total supply, even though they would not participate in a vote.

getPastVotes(address,uint256).details: Returns the amount of votes that `account` had at a specific moment in the past. If the `clock()` is configured to use block numbers, this will return the value at the end of the corresponding block.

getVotes(address).details: Returns the current amount of votes that `account` has.

onAfterAddLiquidity(address,address,uint.details: Called if the `shouldCallAfterAddLiquidity` flag is set in the configuration. The Vault will ignore `hookAdjustedAmountsInRaw` unless `enableHookAdjustedAmounts` is true. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.amountsInRaw: Actual amounts of tokens added, sorted in token registration order
params.amountsInScaled18: Actual amounts of tokens added, sorted in token registration order
params.balancesScaled18: Current pool balances, sorted in token registration order
params.kind: The type of add liquidity operation (e.g., proportional, custom)
params.pool: Pool address, used to fetch pool information from the Vault (pool config, tokens, etc.)
params.router: The address (usually a router contract) that initiated an add liquidity operation on the Vault
params.userData: Additional (optional) data provided by the user

returns._0: True if the pool wishes to proceed with settlement
returns._1: New amountsInRaw, potentially modified by the hook

onAfterInitialize(uint256[],uint256,byte.details: Called if the `shouldCallAfterInitialize` flag is set in the configuration. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.bptAmountOut: Amount of pool tokens minted during initialization
params.userData: Optional, arbitrary data sent with the encoded request

returns._0: success True if the pool accepts the initialization results

onAfterRemoveLiquidity(address,address,u.details: Called if the `shouldCallAfterRemoveLiquidity` flag is set in the configuration. The Vault will ignore `hookAdjustedAmountsOutRaw` unless `enableHookAdjustedAmounts` is true. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.amountsOutRaw: Actual amount of tokens to receive, sorted in token registration order
params.amountsOutScaled18: Scaled amount of tokens to receive, sorted in token registration order
params.balancesScaled18: Current pool balances, sorted in token registration order
params.bptAmountIn: Amount of pool tokens to burn
params.kind: The type of remove liquidity operation (e.g., proportional, custom)
params.pool: Pool address, used to fetch pool information from the Vault (pool config, tokens, etc.)
params.router: The address (usually a router contract) that initiated a remove liquidity operation on the Vault
params.userData: Additional (optional) data provided by the user

returns._0: True if the pool wishes to proceed with settlement
returns._1: New amountsOutRaw, potentially modified by the hook

onAfterSwap((uint8,address,address,uint2.details: Called if the `shouldCallAfterSwap` flag is set in the configuration. The Vault will ignore `hookAdjustedAmountCalculatedRaw` unless `enableHookAdjustedAmounts` is true. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.params: Swap parameters (see above for struct definition)

returns._0: True if the pool wishes to proceed with settlement
returns._1: New amount calculated, potentially modified by the hook

onBeforeAddLiquidity(address,address,uin.details: Called if the `shouldCallBeforeAddLiquidity` flag is set in the configuration. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.balancesScaled18: Current pool balances, sorted in token registration order
params.kind: The type of add liquidity operation (e.g., proportional, custom)
params.minBptAmountOut: Minimum amount of output pool tokens
params.pool: Pool address, used to fetch pool information from the Vault (pool config, tokens, etc.)
params.router: The address (usually a router contract) that initiated an add liquidity operation on the Vault
params.userData: Optional, arbitrary data sent with the encoded request

returns._0: True if the pool wishes to proceed with settlement

onBeforeInitialize(uint256[],bytes).details: Called if the `shouldCallBeforeInitialize` flag is set in the configuration. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.userData: Optional, arbitrary data sent with the encoded request

returns._0: success True if the pool wishes to proceed with initialization

onBeforeRemoveLiquidity(address,address,.details: Called if the `shouldCallBeforeRemoveLiquidity` flag is set in the configuration. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.balancesScaled18: Current pool balances, sorted in token registration order
params.kind: The type of remove liquidity operation (e.g., proportional, custom)
params.maxBptAmountIn: Maximum amount of input pool tokens
params.minAmountsOutScaled18: Minimum output amounts, sorted in token registration order
params.pool: Pool address, used to fetch pool information from the Vault (pool config, tokens, etc.)
params.router: The address (usually a router contract) that initiated a remove liquidity operation on the Vault
params.userData: Optional, arbitrary data sent with the encoded request

returns._0: True if the pool wishes to proceed with settlement

onBeforeSwap((uint8,uint256,uint256[],ui.details: Called if the `shouldCallBeforeSwap` flag is set in the configuration. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.params: Swap parameters (see PoolSwapParams for struct definition)
params.pool: Pool address, used to get pool information from the Vault (poolData, token config, etc.)

returns._0: True if the pool wishes to proceed with settlement

onComputeDynamicSwapFeePercentage((uint8.details: Called if the `shouldCallComputeDynamicSwapFee` flag is set in the configuration. Hook contracts should use the `onlyVault` modifier to guarantee this is only called by the Vault.

params.params: Swap parameters (see PoolSwapParams for struct definition)
params.pool: Pool address, used to get pool information from the Vault (poolData, token config, etc.)
params.staticSwapFeePercentage: 18-decimal FP value of the static swap fee percentage, for reference

returns._0: True if the pool wishes to proceed with settlement
returns._1: Value of the swap fee percentage, as an 18-decimal FP value

onRegister(address,address,(address,uint.details: Returns true if registration was successful, and false to revert the pool registration. Make sure this function is properly implemented (e.g. check the factory, and check that the given pool is from the factory). The Vault address will be msg.sender.

params.factory: Address of the pool factory (contract deploying the pool)
params.liquidityManagement: Liquidity management flags indicating which functions are enabled
params.tokenConfig: An array of descriptors for the tokens the pool will manage

returns._0: success True if the hook allowed the registration, false otherwise

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

getHookFlags().notice: Return the set of hooks implemented by the contract.

onAfterAddLiquidity(address,address,uint.notice: Hook to be executed after adding liquidity.

onAfterInitialize(uint256[],uint256,byte.notice: Hook to be executed after pool initialization.

onAfterRemoveLiquidity(address,address,u.notice: Hook to be executed after removing liquidity.

onAfterSwap((uint8,address,address,uint2.notice: Called after a swap to perform further actions once the balances have been updated by the swap.

onBeforeAddLiquidity(address,address,uin.notice: Hook to be executed before adding liquidity.

onBeforeRemoveLiquidity(address,address,.notice: Hook to be executed before removing liquidity.

onBeforeSwap((uint8,uint256,uint256[],ui.notice: Called before a swap to give the Pool an opportunity to perform actions.

onComputeDynamicSwapFeePercentage((uint8.notice: Called after `onBeforeSwap` and before the main swap operation, if the pool has dynamic fees.

onRegister(address,address,(address,uint.notice: Hook executed when a pool is registered with a non-zero hooks contract.
